description: Long-Stay National Visa (Type D) for Higher Education in Belgium. Optimized for the 'Blocked Account' solvency track and includes official admin/contribution fee workflow.

meta.processing_time_standard: 4-12 Weeks (Peak Season: July–August may take longer)
meta.max_stay: Duration of Studies (Residence Permit issued in Belgium after arrival)
meta.passport_validity: At least 12 months beyond planned date of arrival
meta.photo_spec: 35x45 mm, white background, meet Belgium photo specs; provide 2 copies
meta.min_funds_requirement:
**Solvency (2025 guidance):**

* Govt minimum ~€835/month net (indexed annually)
* University Blocked Account recommendation: €1,000–€1,050/month (≈ €12,000–€12,600/year)
* Use of University Blocked Account yields highest acceptance probability.

documents.title: Original Passport
documents.description: Passport valid for at least 12 months from arrival, with minimum 2 blank pages. Include color copies of identity and used visa pages.

documents.title: VisaOnWeb Application (VOW)
documents.description: Complete the online visa application via Belgium's VisaOnWeb portal. Print and sign final PDF (3 copies) and note VOW reference number.

documents.title: Proof of Administrative (Contribution) Fee Payment
documents.description: Proof of bank payment of the administrative contribution (≈€236). Use the exact payment reference format (Name Firstname Nationality DateOfBirth) as requested by FPS Home Affairs.

documents.title: Blocked Account / Solvency Certificate (University)
documents.description: Official certificate from university confirming you deposited the required living expenses (blocked account or equivalent). Recommended over private sponsorship.

documents.title: Medical Certificate from Approved Panel Doctor
documents.description: Medical certificate completed by an Embassy-approved doctor (per VFS/VOC list). Use the Belgian Embassy/VFS list for approved practitioners and forms.

documents.title: Apostilled Police Clearance Certificate (PCC)
documents.description: PCC issued by Passport Office (PSK) or local police as required; obtain MEA Apostille (e-Sanad/MEA) for international use.

documents.title: Admission / Acceptance Letter
documents.description: Original official acceptance letter from an accredited Belgian higher-education institution confirming enrolment and start date.

documents.title: Apostilled Degree / Diploma (if requested)
documents.description: Apostilled copies of previous diplomas/degrees where required by university or visa office. Use MEA apostille/e-Sanad for Indian documents.

steps_flow.title: Secure University Admission & Blocked Account
steps_flow.description: Accept your offer and arrange the blocked-account / university solvency transfer (usually €10,000–€13,000 or per university instructions). Obtain an official Solvency Certificate from the institution or bank.

steps_flow.title: Pay the Administrative (Contribution) Fee to FPS Home Affairs
steps_flow.description: Pay the administrative contribution (approx. €236) by international bank transfer to FPS Home Affairs / Immigration Office. Use the exact reference format (Name Firstname Nationality DateOfBirth). Keep the transfer receipt for upload.

steps_flow.title: Complete VisaOnWeb (VOW) Application
steps_flow.description: Register and complete your Long-Stay (Type D) application on VisaOnWeb. Print the final application PDF (3 copies) and save the VOW reference number (required for appointment).

steps_flow.title: Medical Exam & Document Legalization
steps_flow.description: Book and complete the medical exam with an Embassy-approved practitioner; apostille/attest PCC and other required certificates via e-Sanad/MEA before submission.

steps_flow.title: Book VFS Appointment & Submit Documents
steps_flow.description: After completing VOW and payments, book a 'Long Stay Student (Type D)' appointment at the VFS Belgium VAC in India. Submit your originals + 2 photocopy sets, pay VFS service charges and provide biometrics.

steps_flow.title: Track Application & Follow-up to FPS Immigration Office
steps_flow.description: Use the Immigration Office tracking tool to follow the status of files forwarded to FPS Home Affairs. If needed, contact infodesk@ibz.fgov.be with payment proof/reference to resolve contribution issues.

eligibility.required_education: Admission to a recognised Belgian higher-education programme (official acceptance letter required)
